Comment: Jointly with the Committee on Fire and Emergency Management and the Committee on Mental Health, Disabilities and Addiction

Items.Title: Oversight - Preventing Suicide and Promoting Mental Health for First Responders.
Items.ActionText: This Oversight was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Oversight - Preventing Suicide and Promoting Mental Health for First Responders.

Items.Title: Jointly with the Committee on Fire and Emergency Management and the Committee on Mental Health, Disabilities and Addiction
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department to provide mental health information, training, and support services to officers
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department to provide mental health information, training, and support services to officers.

Items.Title: Resolution declaring the third week in May of each year to be recognized as First Responder Mental Health Awareness Week.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Declaring the third week in May of each year to be recognized as First Responder Mental Health Awareness Week.

Items.Title: Oversight - Preventing Suicide and Promoting Mental Health for First Responders.
Items.ActionText: This Oversight was Filed, by Committee
Items.MatterName: Oversight - Preventing Suicide and Promoting Mental Health for First Responders.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department to provide mental health information, training, and support services to officers
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department to provide mental health information, training, and support services to officers.

Items.Title: Resolution declaring the third week in May of each year to be recognized as First Responder Mental Health Awareness Week.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Laid Over by Committee
Items.MatterName: Declaring the third week in May of each year to be recognized as First Responder Mental Health Awareness Week.

Items.MinutesNote: Other Council Members Attending: Holden, Borelli, Levine and Maisel
